content.description: Slightly harder than its sister climb Transform but soft for the grade. Start in crack then slap out left and then up.
content.location: Five feet right of Modest Man in the first part of the Mojo Area.

content.description:
Start by sitting and grasping a sloping edge with the left hand and an opposing sloping feature pinch with the right hand. Bust up and left to a sloper. If you're short--come right back into the right crimp on the middle of the face.

 Work up and perch on a right then transition to a left heel hook on the left hand starting hold to reach sharp holds up on the angle change of the arete. 

 OR 

 Dig left toe under the roof on left collection of nubbins. Throw hard to the left crimp, then deadpointÂ toss from there straight to jug on arete.

 Follow the arete up an easy low angled finish. This is an amazing compression problem.

 *Start beta - People have started this boulder with a right heel and a right hand on the starting hold--The guidebook suggests starting with only the hands on. Do whichever, great pebble.
content.protection: A pad or two will be helpful for the work it will take to solve this problem.
content.location: The main proud difficult looking bulge/prow in the center of the Mojo area.

content.description: A jug-o-licious romp whose only problem is its over too quick.
content.location: First problem you will come across when bushwacking up from the access trail.

content.description: Good climb for little kids or good way to downclimb off the boulder.
content.location: On the opposite side from Modest Man.

content.description: Small area with half a dozen problems just off the Main Area access trail.
